events.name: Book Club: High Performance Browser Networking
events.description:
We're going to be working through this highly-regarded book by Google engineer, Ilya Grigorik: High Performance Browser Networking: What Every Web Developer Should Know about Networking and Web Performance  


This week we'll be covering the last chapter 18: WebRTC Please read the chapter before you come to the meetup! Book club is held at Tim & Wei's residence: 244A Tanjong Katong RdSingapore  437032Singapore Doors open at 6:30, meetup starts at 7. Feel free to ask questions in the SingaporeJS gitter room: https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions
events.location: Tim & Wei's Residence, 244A Tanjong Katong Road, Singapore

events.name: An evening on Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator and After Effects
events.description:
Motion Graphics with Illustrator and After Effects
by Lynus Hee
Adobe Certified Instructor Lynus Hee will demostrate how to convert and re-purpose your existing graphic designs or even stock designs into motion design.
 
Build Animated GIFs in Photoshop Animated
by Mark Plunkett
 
GIF format has been around for many years and you may have seen them in many websites and social media. In this session, we will like to show you how simple it is to create an animated GIF using Photoshop. After this session, you can create fun and interactive banners, icons, logos and images.

Register Here
https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/creative-crew-talks-sep-meeting-2015-tickets-18362390404

events.name: Meteor September Meetup
events.description: Hello everyone, It's time for our September MeteorSG meetup! This is kind of a placeholder for now as some people are starting to ask when the next meetup is :-) *** Call for speakers! Message us on our facebook page (link below) or comment below if you have anything interesting to present! ***  Doors open from 7pm and we will start the talks promptly at 7.30pm.  ==================================== Meetup Agenda: #1 - Ramda.js: another underscore? - Maxim Filimonov Maxim will talk about this functional javascript library. Details: http://ramdajs.com/0.17/index.html #2 - Quick & Dirty Infinite Scroll - Duncan Foster Duncan will explain how to quickly add infinite scrolling functionality to your Meteor application. #3 - Practical Walkthrough - Creating a Mobile app with Meteor, React and Ionic - Rick Behl We will follow this tutorial: https://medium.com/@SamCorcos/meteor-react-ionic-mobile-app-part-1-the-basic-template-9355ebf3397f Please bring your own laptop if you wish to follow along. #4 - Meteor Clinic: - If anyone has any specific Meteor questions or problems they can ask the community here to see if someone can help. So please make a note of any questions/problems you have! Remember - there is no such thing as a 'stupid question' (</a>http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/No_such_thing_as_a_stupid_question) #5 Save the date! - Meteor Global Hackathon on 10-11th October 2015 More details here: <a href="http://info.meteor.com/2015-hackathon">http://info.meteor.com/2015-hackathon #6 Housekeeping - Reminder that we have the following communication channels: Facebook: </a>https://www.facebook.com/groups/meteorjssg Slack: <a href="https://meteorsg.slack.com/">https://meteorsg.slack.com Website & Blog: <a href="http://singapore.meteor.com/"></a>http://singapore.meteor.com/ #7 Socializing / Networking  ==================================== We do also try to allocate some time for anyone to share about any Meteor projects they are working on or would like to talk about. We should have a projector at the venue so please just bring a laptop if you would like to do this. Some talks may be interactive so if you wish to follow along then please bring along a laptop (preferably with Meteor and MongoDB pre-installed). Location: Please note this is a new location for us. Thanks to Duncan for helping to organize. We should have food/beverages provided by the venue ;-) Organizers: Rick Behl, Old school programmer, hacker and entrepreneur Duncan Foster Venue sponsor: Netsuite
events.location: Netsuite, 9 Battery Road, #08-01, Straits Trading Building, Singapore

events.name: Bluemix SG Meetup #4: Rapid Mobile Development with Ionic Framework
events.description: It's the 4th Bluemix meetup, and this iteration we have Raymond Camden, developer advocate for IBM, who is flying down all the way from US to do a speaking tour over multiple cities including Kuala Lumpur, Singapore and Philippines. Here's the agenda: 6:00pm to 7:00pm - Registration + Dinner7:00pm to 8:00pm - Mobile Apps with Ionic Framework by Raymond Camden8:00pm to 9:00pm - Open for Topics / Discussion Create amazing mobile apps rapidly with Ionic Framework Ionic is a complete open-source SDK for hybrid mobile app development. Built on top of Angular.JS and Apache Cordova, Ionic provides tools and services for developing hybrid mobile apps using web technologies like HTML5, CSS, and Sass. Learn from Raymond Camden how you can quickly use Ionic to create a beautiful, fast, and responsive mobile apps across both iOS and Android. Raymond Camden Bio:Raymond Camden is a developer advocate for IBM. His work focuses on the MobileFirst platform, hybrid mobile development, Node.js, HTML5, and ColdFusion. He's a published author and presents at conferences and user groups on a variety of topics. Raymond can be reached at his blog (www.raymondcamden.com), @raymondcamden on Twitter.  NUS Enterprise is our supporting partner and venue sponsor for this event.
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.name: Docker night!
events.description:
Hi Dockers, we're glad to announce there will be a Docker Night held on September 9th.  We will meet from 6.30 PM at Paypal and talks will start at 7.15 PM. Mario Loriedo who is a Docker official trainer and active contributor will be presenting!  Here you can read interview with Mario.  Talk n.1 - Docker 101 The first session we will introduce Docker. We will see what issues are addressed by containers and compare it to traditional VMs. Other topics that we will cover are: * Running containers * Creating containers images * Dockerfiles * Inter containers communication with volumes and links * Publishing images and DockerHub Talk n.2 - Spring application development using Docker Talk n.3 - Docker integration inside Cloud Foundry  The event is sponsored and organized by Zenika  About Zenika Zenika is one of the leading providers of professional Open Source services and agile methodologies in Europe.  We provide consulting, development, training and support for the world’s leading Open Source software products, with a strong focus on Java and Java EE as well as agile project management to build high quality software on schedule and reducing the overall costs. Zenika has strategic partnerships on Spring, Tomcat, RabbitMQ and vFabric technologies with SpringSource, a division of VMware, on Eclipse BIRT with Actuate, on MongoDB with 10gen, on Jenkins with CloudBees and on the Varnish Cache with Varnish Software. As a member of the AMQP Technical Committee and the OASIS international standards consortium, Zenika also stands out as an active promoter of open standards and protocols. Zenika has also been from the start supportive of local and national IT user groups through sponsorships and speaker engagements at the Java User Groups, BIRT User Groups, the Spring User Group, etc. Zenika demonstrates its strong and innovative community-driven spirit by organizing conferences, like the annual Eclipse Day Paris and the What’s Next, the first international Java conference ever organized in France. Zenika employs highly-skilled IT professionals, a large number of those being either Open Source committers, book authors, or just bright and passionate people, dealing on a day-to-day basis with real-world challenges. 


A special thanks to PayPal for facilitating the event!
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: [Workshop] Build your Hybrid Mobile App with Ionic, MobileFirst and Bluemix
events.description: You've heard from Raymond Camden about Ionic Framework. Now learn from Raymond directly with this hands-on workshop. Build your Hybrid Mobile App with Ionic, MobileFirst and BluemixGet your hands-on experience with Ionic Framework, IBM MobileFirst services on Bluemix in this workshop. Learn how to develop and build your hybrid mobile application with Ionic, and your back-end servers supporting push notifications, data synchronisation and logging with MobileFirst and Bluemix. To have an idea on Ionic, you may browse the following links:http://ionicframework.com/http://ionicframework.com/getting-started/http://www.raymondcamden.com/2015/03/23/working-with-ibm-mobilefirst-and-the-ionic-framework Reminders:Bring your own laptop with the following installation:    • text editor (e.g., Sublime text)    • Android SDK    • Node.js (specifically npm)    • Create a Bluemix account (http://bit.ly/bluemixsg) Pre-requisite:    • Basic "web" knowledge - HTML, CSS, and JS. You don't have to be an expert, just know the basics.    • Basic "mobile" knowledge - have used a smart phone of some sort and get what 'apps' are. Raymond Camden Bio:Raymond Camden is a developer advocate for IBM. His work focuses on the MobileFirst platform, hybrid mobile development, Node.js, HTML5, and ColdFusion. He's a published author and presents at conferences and user groups on a variety of topics. Raymond can be reached at his blog (www.raymondcamden.com), @raymondcamden on Twitter.  NUS Enterprise is our supporting partner and venue sponsor for this event.
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.name: Come watch the live Ace of Coders finals
events.description: Hi everyone. More than 450 Singaporean students are practicing their python skills this month as part of the IDA Ace of Coders online qualification. If you know any secondary school students or JC students in Singapore, please encourage them to participate. The top 10 schools in each category will get to attend the live event at Suntec City on September 10th and compete for over $9000 in cash prizes.  You can mark your calendar now and plan to come watch some of the best school-aged python developers in Singapore complete in a DOTA2-style Code Combat arena. You can also checkout the latest school rankingsto see how the schools you are most interested in are doing.
events.location: Suntec City Convention Centre, Hall 403, 1 Raffles Boulevard, Suntec City, Singapore 039593

events.name: Pixels, Graphic and Animation
events.description: ======================== Registration Details (at Xerox Building) ========================= Registration starts from 5.45pm, please proceed immediately to level 1, Fuji Xerox Tower at Anson Road (Tanjong Pagar). This session will start at 6.00pm. ========================= Meeting Topics ========================= Session 1 Adobe Edge Animate with James Lee  5 Reasons to use Adobe Edge Animate Adobe Edge Animate has been touted as a replacement for Adobe Flash. Is it true?  Indeed, Edge Animate is a powerful, intuitive software tool that enables you to create interactive animations for the web, iBooks, and apps. Join me in this session and I will share 5 great reasons why you should start using Adobe Edge Animate. Session 2 Adobe Photoshop CC with Leon Lim  Tips, tricks and hidden secrets in Photoshop CC With more than 15 years of using Adobe Photoshop, Leon Lim will share some of the simple tip, tricks and hidden secrets that he has found and used over the years. This session is for both newbies as well as long time users of the software. Session 3 Adobe InDesign CC with Mark Plunkett  Build Animated GIFs in Photoshop Animated GIF format has been around for many years and you may have seen them in many websites and social media. In this session, we will like to show you how simple it is to create an animated GIF using Photoshop. After this session, you can create fun and interactive banners, icons, logos and images. ========================= Agenda ========================= 5.45pm - 6.15pm Session 1: James Lee 6.15pm - 6.35pm Session 2: Leon Lim 6.35pm - 6.45pm Short break & Refreshments 6.45pm - 7.15pm Session 3: Mark Plunkett  ========================= Refreshments ========================= Hot beverages, water and snacks will be provided during the meeting with compliments from Fuji Xerox Singapore. ========================= Facebook ========================= http://www.facebook.com/groups/idugsg/ ========================= Twitter ========================= @InDesignSG ========================= Sponsors ========================= This meeting has been made possible with the generous support of Adobe, Fuji Xerox Singapore, ACE Training, Touch & Print and Dexel.
events.location: Fuji Xerox Singapore, 80 Anson Road, Fuji Xerox Towers, S(079907)
events.group_name: Singapore Graphic Design and Publishing Group

Open Space is a highly collaborative and self-organised meeting where topics are generated on the spot and discussed by the participants through breakout sessions. events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description:
Gazelle Twin and Special Guests
10 Sep, Thu, 7pm to 10pm
Expression Gallery, Level 4
FREE

This ArtScience Late, for the first time in Asia, FutureEverything Singapore will present unique performances from UK artist Gazelle Twin, and new Singaporean music and audio visual talents.

 Fresh from their appearance at 2015 FutureEverything Festival in Manchester, standout British artist, composer and producer Elizabeth Bernholz will perform as her alter ego, Gazelle Twin.  Performing works from her seminal album, ‘Unflesh’, this evening promises to be highly visual with challenging visions of “horror-pop”.

Joining Gazelle Twin is Singapore based Japanese artist Yuzuru Maeda, who will perform pieces from her Zentai Art Project including ‘UFO concert’, a work which asks the question ‘what if we were the only one in the universe?’. The performance will explore dynamic temperature change, climate change, disasters, and extremes in economy and political conflicts, and where the connection between technology and nature can allow us to feel less alone. Together with CIRCUITRIP + NZSDLX, the music starts in a collection of the voices, ending with the music generated by a handmade circuit-bending plastic bra.

FutureEverything Singapore is a partnership between FutureEverything and Singapore's Infocomm Development Authority (IDA), one of the key government agencies championing Singapore’s efforts to become the world’s first Smart Nation. IDA is the organiser of the umbrella programme, the Festival of Tech (www.festivaloftech.sg).

events.name: 16 September: On Trails Through Jungles and Poetry
events.description:
This September, we welcome two groups of speakers with great love for the nature in Singapore. 

Do you know that Singapore still retains some primary rainforest? Our friends, the volunteers from the Lee Kong Chian Natural History Museum (yes, the one with the dinosaurs and the whale) will be sharing about some of the amazing biodiversity that we have in our backyard, and on the threats that  nature faces. 

We also welcome the team behind From Woodlands to Walden, an interfaith anthology of writing about nature in Singapore. The book explores the relationship we have with our environment, providing the opportunity to explore Singapore through "reading trails". It is also a lovely way to get to know some local writers.

We look forward to seeing you soon!

events.name: Investment Trends in Southeast Asia -- How Investors Look at the Region? by @Justin Hall
events.description:
This session is intended to help attendees understand how investors look at potential investments and close deals. It'll not only cover broad investment trends in Singapore and Southeast Asia, but will also help entrepreneurs understand such complex issues like determining when to raise, understanding key terms on a term sheet, and how to pitch to investors. 

Justin Hall is Principal at Golden Gate Ventures, an early-stage venture capital fund based in Singapore but investing across Southeast Asia, Taiwan, and Hong Kong. 

As principal, he manages Golden Gate Ventures' existing portfolio while sourcing investments across APAC. In addition, he is director for Golden Gate Ventures Annex Fund, focused on follow-on funding for existing portfolio companies.

IMPORTANT NOTES FOR ATTENDEES:

* Lunch is sponsored by Golden Gate Ventures for this Hackers & Painters session

* Venue sponsor: NUS Enterprise as usual! :-)

* NUS Enterprise/Plugin has moved to #02-09, so look for the new space right by the stair case on Level 2, Blk 71!  Do not go to the old location at #02-18

See you!

What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved?

What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? 

Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. 

Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss.

You could share about your startup technology stack,your new RubyGem, or your opinions on best practices,so that people can get to know how awesome you are! Ping Winston @winstonyw or winstonyw@gmail.com,or Anna @anna_fil or annafil@gmail.com, or Guo Xiang @tgx_world or tgx_world@hotmail.com See you all soon! --------------Job Postings-------------- Are you looking for Rubyists? events.name: OWASP Zed Attack Proxy Advanced Features - A Demo
events.description: OWASP Zed Attack Proxy (ZAP) is an integrated penetration testing tool for finding vulnerabilities in web applications. Over the past few years, it has significantly grown its popularity, features and contributions from WW engineers, as it comes straight out of the OWASP community, absolutely free of cost and most of all, easy to use! This demo-based training session covers the basics and advanced features of ZAP, which will enable application developers to understand and automate the tool usage, application testers to perform security tests and security engineers to provide consultation on best-practices of using the tool. Speaker:Viswanath S Chirravuri has over 10 years of experience in IT Security space. Currently he is a Software Security Architect for Asia region at a leading digital security company, GEMALTO. He actively holds industry certifications like CISSP, CEH, GWAPT, Security+, PMP and SCJP. Viswanath is accredited by CA Technologies on Identity and Access management suite of products. Over the past 3 years, he has been giving training's on various SAST and DAST tools to application security engineers in financial services and telecommunications industries. NOTE:1. You will need to sign in at ground floor security counter of One Raffles Place Tower 2.2. Akamai will provide a brief update on their view of the threat landscape, and security portfolio.
events.location: Akamai Singapore office, 1 Raffles Place, #16-61, One Raffles Place Tower 2, Singapore 048616

events.name: Gaining Insights Into the Tech Industry
events.description:
<A 2-Hour Info Session on the World of Developers> PLEASE REGISTER HERE>>> With technology progressing so rapidly, programmers are much sought after by companies globally. Coding is now THE SKILL to have. It doesn't matter if you are looking to work in a tech company or build your own start-up, you will needing this very special set of skills.  So if you're still thinking whether there's a place for you in the tech/software industry, wait no more...  Come and hear what our industry expert has to say! Get ready to dive into the world of developers.   Ticket Fees: Early Bird: $15 (Valid till 16 September 2015)Regular: $29Currently only 20 seats left! PLEASE REGISTER HERE>>>  < WHO SHOULD JOIN > Anyone who has the passion, who wants to know more about tech industry and landscape on a local and global scale. This info session is ideal for beginners who are curious, and perhaps aspire to enter the world of coding - either as an employee or business owner, full-time or part-time career. 


< WHAT YOU WILL LEARN > • A day in the life of a coder  • Most sought-after languages/frameworks in the industry • Career development of a developer, salary and demand statistics  • Soft skills: Pair programming, scrumming, project management  • The shortcut to entering the industry  • And get all your questions answered  


SEE YOU THERE!
events.location: Auston Institute of Management, 50 Ophir Road, #02-00, Singapore

events.name: ArtScience Late
events.description:
anGie Seah, with Ian Woo, Aya Sekine and Speak Cryptic
Thursday 8 October, 8pm
ArtScience Museum, Level 4
FREE

Inspired by the phrase ‘Butterflies in the stomach’, anGie Seah attempts to present the physical spectacle of our hearts and guts manifesting such sensations. In a mash up of unpredictable drumming, piano tapping, bass droning, erratic voice-works combined with everyday sounds, anGie together with Ian Woo, Aya Sekine and Speak Cryptic reinterpret emotions and ideas that spoken words fail to evoke. Where words and emotions share no common ground, this immense audio-visual experience will trigger your senses through the orchestra of sounds, actions and imagery. Get ready to open your hearts and minds at this live performance not to be missed.

In partnership with the NTU CCA Singapore Residencies Programme.

Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love
Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md

events.name: A look at Ways To Monetize Your 3D Printing Hobby
events.description: Wondering how to get started on your 3D printing?  Maybe you have started on a 3D model and making your first 3D printed products, but you haven't got a clue how to make money from it?  Hear from our guest artists who will share with you their practical tips and experiences! Join us for a few hours of 3D printing and scanning over some finger food too.  Sign up early - we can only take about 20 people.  See you folks!

events.name: Azure and SGDotNET User Group Meeting @ 13th Nov 2015 7:00pm
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, Meeting Room
